changes.title: History of Changes

release.action: Modified the Changes page so that users can see at a glance the list of pages that have been modified recently on the Cactus web site.
Display the last updated date on the Cactus web site, in the left menu
Some minor refactoring of code (added AbstractTestCase, modified AbstractHttpClient, JspHttpClient, ServletHttpClient).
Add handling of multivalued HTTP headers (same header name with different values) in ServletTestRequest.
Made the methods setUp() and tearDown() protected on the server side so that it is consistent with JUnit.

Modified the Ant runservertest task so that it also works when a servlet engine is already up and running and when a server is already stopped prior. This is to support intensive debugging mode when we don't want to start/stop the server all the time.
Added a "Cactus scope and status" page on the web site that explains the current scope and status of Cactus.
Added a "Cactus goals" page on the web site that gives rough goals and guidelines for the future of Cactus.
Improved build process so that it nows works even if junit, stylebook, .. jars are not in the CLASSPATH prior to running the build.
Updated the Cactus distribution so that everything is contained into one single file (doc + jars + sample). The sources are available separately in a second file.
Added a section on the main web site page to explain the reason for the Cactus name.
Changed the web site skin to be the Jakarta skin and not the Apache XML skin. This is because Cactus is now part of the Jakarta Commons project.
Updated the web site installation section to better explain the required steps to install Cactus. Namely, it covers installing Ant and installing the Cactus Sample application.
Removed the deliverable dependencies jar. Instead, provides a zipped installation of Ant containing the needed jars for tasks used by Cactus and Cactus Sample build files.
Removed the misc/ directory and JBuilder files from CVS and source distribution.

Renamed the project from J2EEUnit to Cactus. Although it was a difficult decision to make, it had to be done as J2EE is a Sun trademark. Renamed all occurrences of J2EEUnit to Cactus and changed package names (from j2eeunit.* to org.apache.commons.castor.*.
The sample application sources now contains all needed configuration files (the manifest and web.xml files were missing in the previous release).
Donated the project to the Apache Software Foundation. Changed license from GPL to APL. Moved packages from j2eeunit.* to org.apache.commons.j2eeunit.* and changed copyrights
